
We need to use the *AmberTools* program, `tleap`, to generate the IDP fragments to generate the fragment library. We will install the `conda` version of *AmberTools*.

1.  Go to the [Amber Download page](https://ambermd.org/GetAmber.php).
2.  Choose *Option 1: Binary distribution via conda*.
3.  Type the following into a Terminal:

``` {.bash filename="Terminal"}
conda create --name AmberTools23
conda activate AmberTools23
```

::: callout-note
From the [AmberTools installation page](https://ambermd.org/GetAmber.php):

> Note that you would need to perform the "conda activate" step every time you wish use AmberTools23 in a new terminal

To deactivate a `conda` environment, just use

``` {.bash filename="Terminal"}
conda deactivate
```
:::

4.  Next type:

``` {.bash filename="Terminal"}
conda install -c conda-forge ambertools=23
```

::: callout-note
To keep *AmberTools* up to date, type the following:

``` {.bash filename="Terminal"}
conda update -c conda-forge ambertools
```
:::
